results.title: The Perfect hero
results.creator_credit: Kent Martin, Barbara Doran and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An insider’s look at the business of romantic fiction writing at Harlequin Publishing. Writers, editors, designers and the male models who pose for the book covers discuss their own roles and the expectations of the readers. Readers discuss the appeal of the romantic genre, and argue its literary merit. Features interviews with writers Barbara Cartland, Virginia Henley and Heather Graham.

results.title: The Perfect English village
results.creator_credit: VATV, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and Nigel Farrell
results.brief_description: Producer/director/author and broadcaster Nigel Farrell leaves the chaos of the city in his Morris-Minor in search of the perfect, tranquil, village. Does it exist? Nigel is determined to find out. On his mission he locates beautiful villages in Sussex, Wiltshire, Devon, Essex and North Yorkshire, none of which seems to fit his impression of the perfect village. Nigel does eventually solve the puzzle of a tranquil idyll, but not where you expect it.

results.title: The Percussions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instruments of the band and orchestra”.
Explains that percussion instruments emphasise rhythm and provide special sound effects in marching bands, concert bands and orchestras. Includes demonstrations of the bass drum, snare drum, field drum, tympani, cymbals, tambourine, temple blocks, triangle, castanets, claves, gong, marimba, bells and chimes.

results.title: The Perception of life
results.brief_description: A history of the microscope. Deals with the evolution of ideas about the smallest units of life and the relation between what a scientist sees and the theories he creates. It begins with the work of the early microscopist and ends with our current theories of DNA and viruses. Narrated by Stephen Toulmin.

results.title: The Peoples of Africa
results.brief_description: Provides an economic, sociological and geographical study of the various peoples of Africa. Describes the influence that the Arabian and Negro elements along with the Bushmen, Pygmy and Indian contingents have had on African development. Also indicates the importance of European immigration. No other credits available.

results.title: The People with love and faith
results.creator_credit: Weng Jeng-Yih, Kwang Hwa Mass Communications, Cheng Yi Communications and Ko-Lun Huang
results.brief_description: This program serves as a testimonial to the endeavours of the Taiwanese to rebuild their society: economically, socially and culturally. It focuses on the achievements of individuals, each of whom have contributed to the successful relocation of their society onto the Island of Taiwan. It was once said that “Taiwan is like the oyster in the Pacific. It turns sand into pearls.” For the filmmakers, this national pride provided a source of inspiration, in the hope that others will share their sentiments.

results.title: The People vs. Larry Flynt
results.creator_credit: Ixtlan, Oliver Stone, Janet Yang, Michael Hausman and Milos Forman
results.brief_description: This is the story of the rise and rise of a self-confessed “smut-peddler”, Larry Flynt (Woody Harrelson) and his wife Althea (Courtney Love) and his building of a publishing empire, of which “Hustler” magazine is the figurehead. Along the way Flynt gets dragged to court by several exponent of the religious right, intent on defending the “decent folks”. At every turn, Larry fights back, using a tactic of high antics and retreat behind the “First Amendment”. Courted by the Pentecostal movement and Ruth Carter (Jimmy’s sister) played by Donna Hannover, he finally converts, only to give his campaign for “free speech and porn for all” the overtones of a crusade. The true life story of Larry Flynt is rich in sex, drugs, making money - and an assassination attempt. Who is Larry Flynt: a hedonistic, obnoxious pornograph or or an unlikely freedom of speech campaigner whose ardour is only tamed by drug addiction, mental illness, and Althea’s failing health? This film won two Oscar nominations to Forman and Harrelson. Winner of Golden Bear, Berlin - 1997. Includes cameos by Larry Flynt, James Carville (former Clinton ‘91 campaing director) and Donna Hannover.

results.title: The People v the 'roo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
The kangaroo is observed in its own environment, and the people who are most likely to affect its future are interviewed: the grazier, the wildlife officer, the shooter and the pet food supplier.

results.title: The People of Parliament
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Geoffrey Barnes and Ian Host
results.brief_description: This documentary explains the functions of Parliament by following the parliamentary day of two senators (Bob Collins and Kay Patterson) and two members of the House of Representatives (Kathy Sullivan and Stephen Martin). Parliamentarians are shown at work in their offices, at meetings of Parliamentary committees and at party political meetings as well as participating in debate in their respective houses.
